page.title: 14CUSTOMS AND EVENTS
page.content: Each year in May are the{May Gala {Celebrations}and the crowning of the May Queen. On{November 6th}is the{St. Leonard' s {Day Service}and parish supper. On the {11th November}at sunrise is the{Wroth {Silver Ceremony.}When rents are paid to the agent of the Duke of Buccleuch on Knightlow Hill, to the east of the village(see Stretton on Dunsmore). In recent years there have been problems as halfpennies could not be got. The{Sunday nearest the 11th}is {Armistice Day}with wreath laying at the village War Memorial. { Ryton First School celebrated it's {centenary in 1985. The{Dilke family,}once owners of Ryton Manor, are remembered in the name of one of the village public houses and in one of the church charities.
